channel.title: My Blog Posts on Rob Wiederstein - a blog about coding, data and public policy
channel.description: Recent content in My Blog Posts on Rob Wiederstein - a blog about coding, data and public policy

item.title: Color Palette Selection from Historic Maps
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: By default, Hugo automatically takes the first 70 words of your content as its summary and stores it into the .Summary page variable for use in your templates. You may customize the summary length by setting summaryLength in your site configuration or you can set it in the front matter.

item.title: Predicting Building Energy Usage
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: This post predicts appliance energy usage.

item.title: Building Energy Usage Exploratory Data Analysis
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: Exploratory data analysis of building energy usage.

item.title: Package Management in R
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: Managing dependencies is required when building packages. This post reviews some common functions and strategies. It doesn’t discuss including packages in the description or namespaces.

item.title: Embedding a Trelliscope Widget in GitHub Pages
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: By default, Hugo automatically takes the first 70 words of your content as its summary and stores it into the .Summary page variable for use in your templates. You may customize the summary length by setting summaryLength in your site configuration or you can set it in the front matter.

item.title: Great Hack for Documenting R Package Data
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: When creating a package, documenting your data is a crucial step. While important, it can also be time-consuming. A high-dimensional dataset would require describing each variable. This post gives a quick method to pass an R-CMD-check and document data.

item.title: Multilingual Letter Frequency in Literature
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: This post is about letter frequency from four works of literature. Each one is in a different language. Letter frequency analysis is how simple substitution ciphers are cracked in cryptography.

item.title: A Zotero and Rmarkdown Workflow
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: You can use Rmarkdown to generate LaTeK documents and Zotero to track your citations. This post explains a possible workflow.

item.title: Alexandria Population by Block
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: This post is a choropleth map of Alexandria, Virginia. The project required a geographic file at the block level and a demographic file for population. Both were downloaded from the US Census Bureau.

item.title: A Zotero Tutorial for Beginners
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: Zotero is a database for research. Authors use it to organize their citations and notes. Regardless of project size, Zotero facilitates recall, summarization, discoverability and reproducibility. This post explains the first steps in using Zotero for a research paper in LaTeX.

item.title: Choropleth Map of Job Change by County
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: The annual employment data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) was downloaded for the years 1990 through 2021. The average annual growth rate was computed by county and plotted as a choropleth map.

item.title: Using Color in R Plots
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: Using color effectively is key for informative and accurate plots. R packages can provide tried-and-true palettes to ease the process.

item.title: Laser Incidents on U.S. Aircraft
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: U.S. pilots have reported an increasing number of laser incidents in the last few years. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) collects the reports and publishes them in a database.

item.title: Tidy Tuesday Hidden Gems
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: The #tidytuesday release was the hidden gems project, a collection of notebook reviews from Kaggle.

item.title: Rectangling IRS 990s-Part-06
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: This posts converts an IRS 990 in xml format to tabular data.

item.title: List Inspection-Part-04
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: List inspection is key to the effective manipulation and transformation of the data.

item.title: Rectangling-Part-05
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: Rectangling is the process of untangling lists into tables.

item.title: List into Tibble-Part-03
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: Function returns and data are often in list form. Some, like myself, prefer to convert them to a table or data frame to perform computations. Lists of equal lengths are easy to convert to a table, but lists of unequal lengths can be problematic. The tibble package allows for lists to be stored in the column of a data frame.

item.title: List Iteration-Part-02
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: This post is about how to iterate over and extract from a list. It begins with the function lapply() since many people are familiar with it and then expounds on functions in the purrr package.

item.title: List Basics-Part-01
item.author: rob@robwiederstein.org (Rob Wiederstein)
item.description: This post deals with list basics.
